bibl.title: An Egyptian Priest at Delphi: Calasiris as theios aner in Heliodorus' Aethiopica.
bibl.note: Contribution to the international symposium Greek Priests from Homer to Julian, August 25-28, 2003, in Washington, DC. - 1. The Discovery of the Priest in the Greek Novel. - 2. The Poetics of Reading in Heliodorus' Aethiopica. - 3. The Aethiopica as a Program of Education for a the theios aner.

bibl.title: Practitioners of the Divine: Greek Priests and Religious Officials from Homer to Heliodorus.

bibl.seg: Baumbach Manuel, An Egyptian Priest at Delphi: Calasiris as theios aner in Heliodorus' Aethiopica.
Beate Dignas and Kai Trampedach (Edd.), Practitioners of the Divine: Greek Priests and Religious Officials from Homer to Heliodorus = Hellenic Studies. 30 (Washington, DC, 2008) pp. 167-183.

Contribution to the international symposium Greek Priests from Homer to Julian, August 25-28, 2003, in Washington, DC. - 1. The Discovery of the Priest in the Greek Novel. - 2. The Poetics of Reading in Heliodorus' Aethiopica. - 3. The Aethiopica as a Program of Education for a the theios aner.
